body.p: To create hierarchical linking between the topics in a DITA map, you set the appropriate value of the collection-type attribute on the map. See the DITA documentation for the meaning of each of the values of the collection-type attribute.
body.note: Note that the decision on when and how to create hierarchical links is made by the publishing scripts. The collection-type attribute does not force a particular style of linking. Rather, it declares what the nature of the relationship is between the topics. The publishing scripts use that information to decide how to link topics. Scripts for different media may make different decisions depending on what is appropriate for the media. You can provide additional instructions to the scripts using the linking attribute.
body.p: To add the collection-type to an item in a map:

ol.li: Right click on the topic and choose Edit Properties.... The Edit Reference dialog is displayed.
Choose the appropriate value from the Collection type drop down.

body.p: The Edit Reference dialog does not include the linking attribute. To add a linking attribute:

ol.li: Right click on the map icon in the DITA Maps Manager and choose Open Map in Editor. The map is opened in the Editor.

You can add the linking attribute in Author mode by placing the caret on the topic reference and hitting Alt+Enter or you can edit it in Text mode by adding the attribute to the appropriate reference element (a topic-ref element in most cases).
